intro: Pimelea oreophila subsp. hetera, commonly known as the mountain pimelea, is a shrub native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Thymelaeaceae and is characterized by its narrow, needle-like leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats, often in open forests or heathlands. Its flowering period occurs during the spring, and it is adapted to withstand drought conditions. The subspecies hetera is distinguished by its specific leaf morphology and geographic distribution.
